text: cp-2021-0003 fa northec; stiff back a loaded rock truck was heading downhill on the cote mine road when the truck's back end slid out on the road. the operator tried to correct it but resulted in the box tipping on its side. light snow was falling, leading up to the event. scene was frozen and supervisor was contacted. ip was taken to onsite pa for assessment and given otc’s for stiffness in lower back. road conditions were addressed (graded and sanded). rock truck box was flipped upright. investigation initiated.

category: hand or arm injury, head or face injury
text: welding rod came into contact with employee forehead causing a small scrape. at approximately 2:15 pm while conducting welding activities for the open drain piping, a massy wood employee stopped to clean the weld on a 4” carbon steel pipe.  after cleaning the pipe he proceeded to flip his mask to start the welding operations when the welding rod he was holding in his right hand came in contact with his forehead causing a small scrape. there was no evidence that suggests injuries could have occurred to more than one person and potentially no more than a first aid treatment. he immediately proceeded to the first aid room where the scrape was cleaned with an antiseptic wipe and he was cleared to return to work.

an eight-wheel dumper truck has left the road after passing a pick-up truck with trailer on a narrow section of road.  an eight-wheel dumper truck has left the road after passing a pick-up truck with trailer on a narrow section of road. no personnel injured and no material damage reported.  site safe. reported that the road remains open.
ip tested positive for covid-19 while at home on leave ip tested positive for covid-19 while at home on leave ip is self-isolating at home

neck strain employee was lifting buckets of wet concrete and then pouring the concrete from height.  while performing this task a second time the employee felt a strain on the right side of the neck. employee contacted workcare and was given self-care, first-aid advice.  no additional treatment required.

during oil flushing activities, the air filter on the test kit sheared from the housing under 30bar pressure a baker hughes work scope involving a 3 man work party commenced between the mezzanine and cellar deck of the bwhp, with the task of “hot oil flushing” using transaqua. a valve was adjusted to increase the temperature of the transaqua and the flow rate during flushing of the well 05b (6mm line).  during the operation, a valve was inadvertently knocked into a slight open position, allowing pressured transaqua into the air supply filter.  this, subsequently, blew the air filter from its housing and allowed approx. 3 litres to escape the system. a purpose made bund assisted in the containment, with a small quantity being sprayed onto the gratings, and in turn onto the cellar deck below. no injuries were sustained, only minor asset damage. 1.	handle returned to the fully closed position, stemming all loss of transaqua2.	flushing unit closed down (turned off)3.	clean up action4.	incident reported5.     tofs held with all hook up personnel

category: dropped object or material, lifting or moving loads
text: forklift driver dropped equipment wood forklift driver dropped a eftech heat exchanger and damaged some cladding while moving the unit nan

category: foot or leg injury, hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: slipped in compressor room building k1001 and injured wrist migrated from legacy cairs incident #31327ip was placing a plastic bag over the end of the cable when he slipped on the oily floor, placing his hand out as he fell. electrical team had returned to unit to cover cables. ip had been in the room before and the floor had been cleaned. this time the floor was again soiled, however proceeded to work.ip has some soreness in his wrist the wrist was x-rayed with negative results, as a precaution. ip will return to normal duties and ensure he does not exacerbate the injury or recovery progress. will have regular reviews with the site based nurse in the viva energy medical centre.follow up precautionary x-ray on 26th sept, again negative issues. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

subcontractor mechanic parked next to the tractor and drag box to perform repairs. after repairs were complete the operator turned left to clear the truck causing the drag box to scrape against the side grated platform located on the  mechanics truck migrated from legacy cairs incident #34102operator was inspecting equipment before use and noticed a small leak around the axel. the ohio cat mechanic was already onsite servicing the 815 compactor. the operator asked the mechanic to look at the leak and he determined the leak needed to be repaired before the equipment could be operated. the mechanic pulled his truck over to the tractor and drag box and started repairing the equipment. when the repairs were complete the operator moved the equipment forward then turned left to clear the mechanics truck. while completing the left turn the drag box scraped against the grated platform on the rear of the service truck. the operator immediately stopped, assessed the situation and contacted his manager. the employee completed a post accident test which returned negative results. no injuries to report migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description
wood employee (working from home) tested positive for covid-19 ip tested positive for covid 19. while workin form home. however ip is not exhibiting any symptoms ip is under monitoring and isolation

fac- minor cut to lip from ladder racking ip took the ladder rack off from sub cellar and then went to the work bench on the cellar deck to cut a section from it, there was a spar which needed to be cut out at the weld. cut had been made three quarters of the way through when work party decided to manipulate material to break off final quarter, whilst doing this piece slipped and caused cut to top lip.   ip went to the medic who cleaned cut with disinfectant.

category: foot or leg injury, general injury
text: scaffolder reported minor sprain to ankle as a result of stepping on uneven surface at new crib hut installation area for viva turnaround migrated from legacy cairs incident #30838scaffold person walking in area and working on new temporary crib huts suffered a minor sprain to ankle. reported to hse and supervisor and escorted to site medical facility as a precaution. returned to normal duties. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

ip contracted malaria    ip played basketball the prior evening, went to work around 0700, attended morning meeting and felt unwell after meeting. ip went to clinic where he was tested for malaria which came back positive. ip was given oral medication to take several days and sent to accommodation for bed rest. ip has been taking his doxycycline.  ip was treated at clinic for malaria and sent to accommodation for bed rest. has a follow-up visit for 16 march 2020.

category: dropped object or material, near miss
text: falling object - near miss a fitter had taken two gusset plates on to a scaffold platform at 5.8 mtr height. each plate 300 x 400 x 8mm, weight 6.5kg. the plates were laid next to a scaffold ladder access point and close to the toe board. there was a 10mm gap between the toe board and the scaffold deck boards. as the fitter was moving around the scaffold platform his foot came into contact with the plates and one of the plates fell through the gap between the toe board and the scaff deck. the plate fell to grade, hitting structures on the way down. no persons were in the area below the scaffolding and no work was planned in the area under the scaffold. stopped the work and initiated investigation process

category: foot or leg injury, hand or arm injury
text: worker was closing lid on a green lee box located in m51 east when he caught the tip of his left ring finger in lid migrated from legacy cairs incident #36074worker was closing lid on a green lee box located in m51 east when he caught the tip of his left ring finger in lid resulting in crush injuryworker to health centre for assessment: finger irrigated with normal saline solution and bulky dressing applied. on call physician consulted and worker casavaced on flight for assessment onshore at health science centrehospital. worker given non-prescription medication for pain relief. tetanus status up to datex-ay shows fracture and follow up with plastic surgeon 9th december, given prescription ain medication migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

incorrect drawings for isolation when applying idp 300175 for tar scopes to facilitate work under permit no.s 299977 & 300078, instrument tech was applying the idp as per the isolation using the marked up platform drawings and identified that energy was present.  the correct isolation applied as per the platform drawings which would indicate that the drawings are incorrect. instrument tech informed oim/aa.  isolation stepped back to see if it could be resolved, however, the drawings were not correct.  isolation was then completed and closed off to allow new permit and idp to be created to conduct work scope.  the glanding of cable on xxv1300 was removed from the work scope to allow other work on the plan to continue as per the tar plan.

data floor plate falls through the floor and hits the operator on the mouth / tooth an mct (cable entry in the wall) had been opened in connection with cable pulling under the data floor in the battery room. this had to be sealed again before the coffee break. after a decision in the work team that consisted of 2 people, person 1 went out of the room to find tools (vacuum lift) for removing the data floor plate. a couple of plates had already been removed / lifted off in the center of the room. person 2 then chose to go down under the floor by using the already removed plates. when person 1 returned, he started lifting the plate over the mct with the vacuum lifter, not knowing that person 2 was under the floor and had started the work (he assumed that person 2 had gone out for a break). when person 1 lifts off the floor plate, and sees that person 2 is under, he quickly pulls the plate back. the plate then detaches from the suction cup and falls obliquely into the opening, lands on the edge, gets a rotation and hits person 2 who looks up in the face. corner of the plate that hits the face / mouth results in a sore on the mouth and a crack in a tooth. correct pvu used. •	medic/nurse consulted offshore. dental care consulted by telephone. no need for immediate treatment but follow-up check after returning home.•	review of the incident with involved / mobilized personnel•	assess the need for the introduction of a routine for controlling vacuum lifts•	carry out root cause analysis.•	carry out incident review panel (irp) “light” for relevant personell in norway, including review of performed root cause analysist•	establish and distribute wood lessons learned (one-pager)•	report the incident to the norwegian authorities in accordance with requirementsthe (ptil and nav)

hexagon staff employee was admitted to local hospital for malaria symptoms while home on rotational leave migrated from legacy cairs incident #3769217- march– 2018ip departed home for his rotational leave in the philippines. 24-march-2018hexagon pm got indications from mutual acquaintances that employee was admitted to a local hospital for malaria symptoms.hexagon pm and country manager attempted calling the ip directly to make contact, send an email to our agent in the home country for more details (attached email).summary from employee agency in the philippines: (23- march-2018)ip initially tested positive in his home city (tagbilaran city, bohol) after experiencing off and on fever, excessive sweating and chills and was diagnosed to be positive with malaria. upon travel to san lazaron in manila, ip was admitted saturday initially tested negative for malaria, but was treated due to symptoms.27-march-2018ip was discharged from hospital as ip was not showing any other symptoms of malaria and all vital signs were ok. ip was requested to rest - ip stayed in manila for one week after discharge from hospital. hexagon pm requested medical information and follow-up review03-april-2018information passed on to hexagon country manager by ip.ip was monitored for 3 consecutive dayswith 12 hour intervals checks in the government run hospital in manila for malaria with all microscopic test results returning as negative. released from hospital 3-27-18.final diagnosis was his intermittent fever and chills may be due to a viral infection.fit for work return has been requested once complete medical abstract is available. normal rotational return is scheduled for eg arrival april 14th. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

mtc; waiward; laceration middle right finger; ks-2017-0054 2 workers were measuring a c-channel approx. 8 ft. long weighing approx. 200 lbs. channel was standing lengthwise on edge on 2 pieces of dunngae. after measuring is complete, witness stands up using the standing channel for support. channel tipped over, landing on ip's tip of middle right finger causing a laceration. ip was wearing gloves at the time of the incident. scene frozen and safety notified. ip taken for assessment at onsite medical clinic, ip was sent to moose jaw hospital for further assessment, 4 sutures were required to close the wound.  investigation initiated.

ip felt liquid dripping onto his face from the conveyor above.  whilst carrying out noise monitoring in oc1 under c1 / c2 conveyor, ip felt liquid dripping onto his face. ip applied dap as per site procedure and went to medical center for assessment. whilst receiving facial flushed at medical center, ip felt irritation to the eye.  site medic referred to medical center for further evaluation. work stopped.self administered dap.went to the medical center for assessment and referred to peel health center.incident reported.

managed contractor employee tested positive for covid-19 managed contractor employee tested positive for covid-19. this is understood to be a community transmission.  managed contractor employee entered self-isolation as per government requirements.

after refueling the forklift and driving off the operator noticed that he was leaking fluid on the road. the operator forgot to replace the fuel cap. approximately 2-3 cups of diesel fuel was cleaned up from the roadway per client protocols. migrated from legacy cairs incident #39836the involved employee filled the forklift up with diesel fuel and drove east down celanese avenue a. when he reached the stop sign at the first intersection he realized the equipment had spilled fuel onto the road. the employee stopped the equipment and examined it for the source of the leak. he found the fuel tank cap had not been secured properly. approximately 2-3 cups of diesel fuel had spilled onto the road in multiple areas from the point of re-fueling to the point of discovering the problem. none of the places the diesel was spilled involved enough liquid to run off the road. the spill points were cleaned up immediately per client protocol. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

metallic top of a hand drilling hammer dropped out. a strabag worker dismantled a hand hummer during hammering, probably due to the poor condition of the hand tool. the metallic element dropped out and fallen down near his feet. nobody got injured and no damages to the nearby materials. hammer removed from the site area and activity stopped.strabag to check the conditions of all hands tools before restart the activities.
home working ip tested +ve for covid-19. home working ip tested +ve for covid-19.  line manager in regular contact with ip.

individual tested positive for covid-19 during pre mobalising checks the indavidual (psc employee) was mobilised to hallmark hotel for isolation and covid-19 testing (pcr) prior to mobilising offshore. on the 12/10/2020 the ip received results stating it was positive for covid-19. the ip is traveling home in a hire vehicle. the ip was not displaying any signs or symptoms of covid-19. idividual is traveling home in his hire car and has been advised to self isolate

employee put vehicle into neutral, exited to get some paperwork and it rolled backwards into another vehicle. migrated from legacy cairs incident #30445employee was backing out of a parking spotin a cheniere vehicle then remembered information he needed in the office. he put the vehicle into neutral, exited to getthat information, and while in the office,it rolled backwards into another vehicle causing a small dent in the bumper. the employee was in a rush working to correct an system upset in the plant. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

during pickup of subcontractor dumpsters on site, a pile of solar modules was struck by the loading truck. during pick up of dumpsters on site for a subcontractor for final removal from site, the loading truck ran into a pallet of replacement modules, damaging 5 of the 9 modules. the truck had made 4 trips to site today and during that time is when the incident occurred. no injuries as no one was working in the area. pictures were taken of the scene to show tire tracks leading from the dumpster location and the module pallet.

category: bites (animals or insects), hand or arm injury
text: a employee was stung by a wasp whilst at work migrated from legacy cairs incident #37955@ 15:30: a wood employee was completing routine perimeter light checks, whilst doing this from the knuckle boom lift he open the panel which had a hole for cabling to the pole. a wasp flew out due to the disturbance and was quite aggressive which resulted in the employee receiving a sting to the right hand.the employee was wearing gloves for the task being completed.the exxon supervisor was there and took the employee to the isos clinic for evaluation, he then contacted wood.the employee was treated (fac) and released back to work fit for normal duties migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

4x client reps tested +ve for covid-19 4x client reps tested +ve for covid-19 over the weekend. they had been working in the woking office last week remaining client and wood personnel told to stay away from the office. all are using daily lateral flow tests.

category: foot or leg injury, line strike, lifting or moving loads
text: struck by object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee was cleaning a concrete pump and breaking down the pipe. he was running a pig through the pipe when an air pocket in the pipe caused the pipe to buck and strike him, breaking his left tibia. he was hospitalized.

caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified an employee was preparing to remove a film roll from a chuck. the roll was pulled and the first employee's right index finger was caught between the roll and a cradle. he suffered an amputation to the finger.

category: foot or leg injury, hand or arm injury
text: entangled in other object or equipment on or about september 13, 2016, an employee's right hand became caught in a tag line that was attached to the butt of a 40-foot pole. the employee suffered a broken right arm and femur.
inhalation of harmful substance-single episode an employee was driving an armored vehicle when it broke down. the employee inhaled smoke and was hospitalized.
exposure through intact skin, eyes, or other exposed tissue an employee was working on a pump when material that was 45% potassium hydroxide sprayed out and contacted his face.
other animal bites, nonvenomous an employee was conducting pest control duties at a residence and was bitten by a dog. the employee was hospitalized.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was shoveling dust and water around a baghouse. as the employee tried to clear a clog in a drain hole, an auger grabbed his right glove, amputating the middle finger at the first joint.

direct exposure to electricity, unspecified the injured employee was observing another employee raking out an electrical breakroom when an arc flash occurred that caused second degree burns on both arms and minor burns on the employee's face.

struck by or caught in swinging door or gate an employee was holding the bathroom door for a fellow employee when his hand was caught in the door resulting in a partial amputation of the right index fingertip.
pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was run over by a forklift and suffered an amputation of his lower left leg.
contact with objects and equipment, unspecified an employee was hanging up concrete chutes when the employee's left index fingertip was amputated by the chutes.

exposure to environmental heat a temporary employee had been loading and unloading tires into a truck trailer when he experienced cramps. he was hospitalized for severe dehydration, heat exhaustion, a kidney injury, and hypochloremia.

fall on same level due to slipping  an employee slipped on ice in a parking lot and fell, her head striking the ground. she was hospitalized, suffering from a brain bleed. on another occasion, another employee also slipped on ice in the parking lot, fell, and hit her head on the ground. she was hospitalized.

note to user: this record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to osha by the employer.  these events are captured as one report.

text: caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was unloading a truck using an auger machine when the machine became jammed. as he attempted to clear the jam by pulling on the belt, the belt started up again. his thumb was then pinched between the belt and pulley, amputating the tip. the machine was energized and the belt and pulley were unguarded at the time of the incident.

text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee lost balance and fell from an unknown height on a three-leg ladder. the employee sustained a fractured ankle that required surgery.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment on january 7, 2017, an employee was operating an overhead crane to lower a section of tooling into a stationary stamping die. he leaned on the stationary stamping die to ensure that the tooling was lined up. as he lowered the tooling, his left fingertip was caught and partially amputated in the opening/pinch point.

category: lifting or moving loads, general injury
text: nonclassifiable an employee was in a scissor lift repairing an oven. a pusher struck the scissor lift. the employee sustained extensive facial and orbital fractures, a left scapula fracture, a t-12 compression fracture, a c-1 fracture, multiple fractured ribs on the left side, a chest wall laceration, upper lip laceration, and a laceration to the nasal tip.

text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part on or about april 15, 2015, an employee was injured and hospitalized when a mini-bulk container fell off of the forks of a forklift and struck him.

caught in running equipment or machinery, n.e.c. an employee was working on a procedure checklist at a splice table machine. his hand was on a bar support above the roll break when it was caught by the roll break and his fingers went into a small gap. his left ring finger was amputated up to half of the nail.
fall on same level due to tripping over an object  an employee tripped on the corner of her desk while getting up. she fell to the floor, suffering a displaced fracture to the right hip.
fall on same level due to slipping  an employee was walking from the plant to his car and slipped on ice falling to the ground and breaking his shoulder.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was in the cooler taking boxes of chicken off a conveyor when his glove and right ring fingertip were caught in a knuckle chain on the conveyor. the first distal segment of the employee's ring finger was damaged and had to be amputated.

category: foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: moving in same direction, nonroadway an employee was driving a forklift while carrying a pallet. a second forklift driver was directly behind the first forklift traveling in the same direction. the pallet blocked the safety sensor on the first forklift, causing it to suddenly stop. the second forklift then hit the first one and the employee on the first forklift suffered two broken legs. one of the leg fractures was a compound fracture.

caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified while cleaning a mix pan, an employee attempted to lower a roller into the pan. the employee's left index fingertip was then caught and amputated between the roller bracket and the pan.
pedestrian vehicular incident, unspecified a skid steer ran over an employee's foot, breaking her right shin.

fall on same level due to slipping  employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell.

category: general injury, back injury, hand or arm injury, fall from or working at height issue

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was reaching through a 4-inch hole to drill a pilot hole into an electrical panel when his left finger touched the trigger on the drill and turned it on. the drill then lacerated the top of his left hand.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation on april 29, 2019, at approximately 9:50 a.m., an employee was operating a punch press when their right index finger was pinched between the dye plate and the post being stamped causing a fingertip amputation.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was feeding a band into a strapping machine when the machine reactivated and caught his left hand, crushing and lacerating it. the machine was unguarded at the time.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was getting ready to grind a part. the lathe (rotating roll) was turned off but was still spinning when the employee's hand was pulled into a pinch point between the roll and grinding wheel, amputating a finger.

category: fall from or working at height issue
text: fall through surface or existing opening 26 to 30 feet on july 26, 2020, an employee received a call from a tenant that the elevator was not working at their rental house. the employee drove to the three-story rental house to fix the issue. while trying to reset the elevator, the employee lost her balance and fell about 30 feet through the sheet rock to the first floor of the elevator shaft. the employee was hospitalized with a back injury.

ignition of clothing from controlled heat source on april 11, 2015, at approximately 0930 hours, an employee was unjamming several bottles passing through a coating hood at the hot end of the man conveyor. as the employee pulled the hot bottles towards himself to unstick them, they hit the floor and shattered. the shattered glass made contact with the hem of his pants, causing a flare up that ignited his clothing. he was burned on approximately 80 percent of his body.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee was cutting meat in the cafeteria with a meat slicer when the meat slipped and fell. he reached to catch the meat and his thumb contacted the slicer blade, amputating the tip of his thumb.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was trying to unstick a conveyor belt. he gripped the conveyor belt with his right hand and pulled on it to get it to move again. his right thumb was still underneath the belt as it began to move. the moving belt pulled the skin off his thumb to the bone, causing a partial right thumb amputation.
ignition of clothing from controlled heat source an employee was cutting rebar with a cut-off saw when the employee's clothing caught fire, causing burns to approximately 70% of the employee's body.
struck by object or equipment, unspecified while breaking apart drilling augers an employee was struck in the head by a pipe wrench and sustained a head injury.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was clearing a jam in a panel/film and tensioner wheel. the employee raided the tensioner wheel set and began pushing the panel/film out of the wheels. the thumb of the his left glove became caught in the tensioner wheel assembly, pulling his hand through the top and bottom wheels. once his hand travelled through, he was able to free it. his left thumb fractured.

part of occupantís body caught between vehicle and other object in nonroadway transport incident an employee was driving a golf cart after loading it with firewood from a storage bin. while the cart was maneuvering in the tight space between the bin and a construction truck parked next to it, the employee's left leg was caught between the bin and the cart. the employee was hospitalized, suffering from swelling and laceration to the leg.

text: pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified on may 15, 2018, at about 4:40 p.m., two employees were using a forklift to transport a frac tank onto a flatbed trailer. the tank was placed on a metal plate positioned on the forks of the forklift. during transport, the frac tank and metal plate shifted, striking the two employees. one employee sustained two fractured knuckles to the left hand, requiring hospitalization.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was starting a parts washer in the heat treat area. the parts washer had been loaded and the door was closing when he attempted to reposition the washer's shroud. the door then came down on his right hand, fracturing several bones.

category: fall from or working at height issue, back injury, head or face injury, dropped object or material, slips & trips
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified two employees were clearing a jam on a baler. once the jam was cleared, both employees fell to the ground below. one of them landed on a concrete surface and suffered a back injury.

category: head or face injury, vehicle incident general, slips & trips
text: fall or jump from vehicle in normal operation, nonroadway an employee was standing on the back of a golf cart while the cart was in motion. the employee fell off the golf cart and struck his head on the pavement, suffering a head injury.
